userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Edward H. House, Papers, 1873-1901, in the Clifton Waller Barrett Library, Accession # 10762, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The collection was transferred from the Barrett Twain papers,on May 23, 1988.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Personal and business correspondence of House chiefly concerns a law suit over the stage production of "The prince and the pauper," an adaptation of Mark Twain's novel of the same name, and several subsequent, related law suits which did not directly involve Twain.

Other topics include House's health, the estate settlements of relatives, royalties, copyright, and his writing, particularly the anti-missionary novel "Yone Santo," and the stories "Midnight warning" and "The Claiborne twins". Events in Japan, particularly the 1894 conflict with China and subsequent Treaty of Shimonoseki are discussed. Edwin Booth, child actors, Ulysses S. Grant's world tour, and Ruralf Dittrich's concerts are mentioned.
